key_activities.content:
ğŸš€ Hiring for a short-term paid collaboration!
Iâ€™m looking for someone to work with me at SCAILE Technologies on a short-term project (2-3 weeks). This is a paid opportunity and could potentially lead to future roles.
ğŸ” Looking for someone with:
>Hands-on experience in browser automation
>Proficiency in both JavaScript and Python
>Experience with Playwright (Selenium/Puppeteer also acceptable)
>Familiarity with AI agents beyond just chatbot frameworks â€“ actual tools and orchestration

ğŸš€ Just launched: Open_PDF2Brainrot â€” The Free, Openâ€‘Source PDFâ†’Brainrot Converter! 
Exams are approaching fast , and I wanted to try the viral PDF to Brainrot microlearning technique. But all the popular tools? Behind steep paywalls. ğŸ’¸
Soâ€¦ I decided to build my own; and Iâ€™m sharing it with everyone. Say hello to: Open_PDF2Brainrot ğŸ‰
What it does:
 âœ… Upload any PDF
 âœ… Autoâ€‘generate clean, structured JSON flashcards ğŸ“‘
 âœ… Turn them into short, punchy Brainrot videos ğŸ¥
 âœ… Browse everything in a slick, responsive web UI ğŸŒ
 âœ… Navigate flashcards + videos like a social feed ğŸ”
Tech Stack: Python, Django, PyPDF2, MoviePy, Vosk, Gemini API.

Iâ€™m happy to share that Iâ€™m starting a new position as an AI Agent Engineering & Marketing Communications Intern at New Native! Excited to get to work alongside the team at the lablab.ai platform. ğŸ’« âœ¨
Thrilled to share that I got selected to attend the Research and Innovation Symposium in Computing (RISC 2025) at Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay organized by CSE at IIT Bombay.

ğŸš€ Leveraging Gemini's Long Context Window to Revolutionize OpenAPI Specification Generation ğŸ‰
Excited to share my submission for the Google Long Context Competition on Kaggle! In this project, I explored how Generative AI, powered by Gemini's long-context capabilities, can streamline the creation of OpenAPI specifications for CRMs. My approach focused on Context Caching, Many-Shot Prompting, and In-Context Retrieval to automatically generate OpenAPI specs from existing API documentation, dramatically improving accuracy and speed.

It was a rewarding experience indeedğŸŒŸ! I learned a lot throughout the Amazon ML Challenge, and it was exciting to see our approach stand out among LLM-based solutions. We ranked 135th out of 700,000+ participants by developing a model without using any LLM, achieving 50.4% accuracy on a classification task from 130,000 images. Despite hurdles, we pushed through and gained valuable insights, making the journey truly worthwhile.
key_activities.note: This was a repost of a teammate's summary of the event.

ğŸš€ Excited to share my first article on Medium, "GAN Inversion: RE-viewing the Image"! ğŸŒŸ This piece dives into the fascinating world of GAN inversion, exploring how it revolutionizes image editing by manipulating the latent vectors. I would love to hear from the community on how I can improve.
